snippet: As Germany opens itself to waves of migrants in dire need, Berlin leaders ponder ways to shelter arrivals in the historic hangars of Tempelhof Airport.
abstract: Germany plans housing 500 to 700 migrants in unused hangar at Berlin’s Tempelhof Airport grounds, airstrip where steady stream of airplanes landed bringing essential supplies to West Berlin residents during Soviet's post-World War II isolation of area; many see plan as fitting use of historic site which was closed to airport traffic in 2008 and has been subject of past development proposals and preservation efforts.
lead_paragraph: As Germany opens itself to waves of migrants in dire need, Berlin leaders ponder ways to shelter arrivals in the historic hangars of Tempelhof Airport.
